chargeHist.descr: Registered Sex Offender Intentionally Photograph a Minor without Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Shannon Lee Maddix was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 25% of prison wages to be applied towards cost

superMiscConds.notes:
DNA sample if not already submitted
No contact with the victim, or family without prior agent approval
No contact with anyone under the age of 18 without prior agent approval and an approved chaperone
Enter into, participate in, and successfully complete any assessments, evaluations and/or treatment programs as directed by agent
Pay all court obligations
Maintain absolute sobriety
Comply with Sex Offender Registry Program

*Amended to reflect that defendant is not eligible for Substance Abuse Program*

records.addlTxt: of Proceedings.  Sentencing Hearing held February 19, 2016
from DOC with response from Judge
Notice of Court Dates and Reporters mailed to Atty. Laufenberg returned undeliverable (incorrect P. O. Box) so hand delivered to Atty. Laufenberg.

records.descr: Notice of intent to pursue post-conviction relief

records.addlTxt: Defendant Shannon Lee Maddix in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls  @ 2:38 pm.  State has reviewed the PSI & sentencing memorandum for defense, State has spoke to victim parents. Atty Laufenberg & defendant has reviewed the PSI. Court has also received sentencing memorandum & letter from Atty Laufenberg. Atty Laufenberg has no factual errors or corrections.  Parents of victim would not like to address court. State gives sentencing argument. Recommends No contact with victim or her family withheld sentence 10 years probation,  Sex offender evaluation and treatment, Probation High standards supervision, Sex Offender Registry, costs, 1 year jail, stipulated. Atty Laufenberg gives sentencing argument.  Recommends withheld sentence 10 years jail, Stipulate to 1 year jail.  Def. has nothing to say.  Court orders costs only, Def. advised of firearm & voting rights. 73 days credit & only if revoked if that is what Judge orders, If State of WI has DNA sample no sample or does not must submit sample & pay $250 surcharge. Atty Laufenberg request to withdrawal plea & set for trial, Judge would like to continue to sentence, 15 years prison  5  years initial confinement  10 years extended supervision, Conditions on pg 15 & 16. No contact with victim or family w/o prior agent of approval, No contact with anyone under the age of 18 w/o prior agent approval or approved chaperone, Enter into participate in  & successfully complete any assessment evaluations treatment program by agent. Pay all court obligations, not ordering 25% prison wages because no restitution. Atty Laufenberg  does not object to be applied to court costs of 25% wages, Court will order, Maintain absolute sobriety, Sex offender registry program. Bond to be returned to poster. Def. advised of postconviction rights.  Atty Laufenberg heard motion to withdrawal plea & set for trial. Court would like Atty to file motion in written but would deny if had to make decision today. Def. is not eligible for challenge program. Def. is eligible for substance abuse program.  Court adjourns @ 3:40 pm.

Defendant Shannon Lee Maddix in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called @ 2:29 p.m. State has complied with victim notification requirements, makes statement. Agreement stated - State will dismiss persistent repeater allegation on ct 1, Def will enter Alford no contest plea. Cts 2 and 3 dismiss and read in. State will cap recommendation -  2:33 off record briefly. Back on record - State will cap recommendation to withheld sentence, 10 yrs probation, stip 1 yr jail as condition of probation, also, counseling deemed appropriate , sex offender registration and sex offender probation, no contact with victim or family and any other conditions deemed appropriate by probation. State will follow agreement unless receives information that compels State to not follow, then Def would be able to withdraw plea. Atty Laufenberg agrees, makes statement. Def agrees. Court grants motion to eliminate persistent repeater allegation. Court reviews elements and possible penalties. Plea to ct 1 as amended - No contest under Alford case. Court reviews plea quest., constitutional rights. Atty Laufenberg satisfied. Court finds Def understands and plea freely & voluntarily made. Cts 2 &3 dismissed and read in on motion of State. Court reviews bench book with counsel regarding plea. Statement by D.A. for factual basis. Response by Atty Laufenberg. Court makes findings for factual basis. Court accepts plea, finds guilty of 2nd degree sexual assualt of child. PSI report ordered. Sentencing memorandum from either counsel invited by the Court. Report to be delivered to Court and Counsel no later than 2/12/16.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 19, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
in Limnie to Include False Allegations Against defendate

Defendant Shannon Lee Maddix in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called @ 11:25 a.m. Statement by Atty Laufenberg.  Def must appear at final pre-trial. Bond remains.  Jury trial scheduled for December 9, 2015 at 09:00 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 23, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Shannon Lee Maddix in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls  @ 1:55 p.m. Def's motion to suppress.  Deputy Michael O'Neill duly sworn on oath, testifies. Witness identifies Defendant. Exhibit 1 - copy of Miranda form. Statement by D.A. Atty Laufenberg has no response. Court denies motion. Statements are admissable. Bond remains.  Status conference scheduled for July 22, 2015 at 11:15 am. Exh. 1 admitted.

Defendant Shannon Lee Maddix in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 11:17 a.m. Statements by Counsel. Request motion hrg be rescheduled.  Motion hearing scheduled for May 6, 2015 at 01:45 pm.

Defendant Shannon Lee Maddix in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 10:49 a.m. Statement by Atty Laufenberg. Bond remains.  Motion hearing scheduled for February 11, 2015 at 11:30 am.
No contact with ALD and no contact with any minor females

Defendant Shannon Lee Maddix in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Defendant Shannon Lee Maddix in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Def will waive right to preliminary hearing.  Statement by Atty Laufenberg.  Court reviews right to preliminary hearing.   Def waives right.  Court will accept waiver of preliminary.  Court finds probable cause, Information filed.  Waive reading of information.  Reserve jurisdictional objections.  Not guilty pleas entered.  Issue of bond.  Court will accept not guilty plea.  Atty Laufenberg presents arguments for bond to be reduced.  Response by State for bond to remain.  Reply by Atty Laufenberg.  Court will reduce bond.  Status conference scheduled for September 17, 2014 at 04:00 pm.

Defendant Shannon Lee Maddix in court via video with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Defendant Shannon Lee Maddix in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Request to modify bond.  Arguments presented by Atty Laufengerg.  Response by DA.  Rebuttal argument   Court will deny request, bond will continue with conditions.
